title: Analyst Sr Quality Data
job_description:
Exciting Opportunity: Analyst Sr Quality Data at University Health in San Antonio!

Are you ready to make an impact in healthcare and be part of a nationally recognized, top-tier health system? University Health in San Antonio, Texas, is seeking a dynamic to join our outstanding team. This position offers an exciting chance to work at one of the most innovative and award-winning hospitals in the region.

Why University Health?

  • Top 10% in the Nation for clinical excellence, recognized by U.S. News & World Report.
  • Magnet® Recognized Hospital – the highest national honor for nursing excellence.
  • A Leader in Patient Care – providing exceptional healthcare to our community with compassionate service.
  • Top-Tier Benefits – comprehensive health plans, generous paid time off, tuition reimbursement, and more!
  • Cutting-Edge Technology – work with the Epic EHR system and collaborate with experts across clinical, IT, and financial departments.
  • A Culture of Collaboration – join a team committed to high-quality service and patient care.

What You’ll Do:

The Analyst Sr Quality Data is involved in monitoring and evaluating outcome measures for Healthcare Transformation Projects within a team-based environment. The position requires identifying quality improvement opportunities, collaborating with various departments, and independently managing tasks. Responsibilities include developing detailed reports and presentations, performing data analysis using Access Databases and Microsoft Excel, and providing insights on healthcare data to improve processes. The role also involves assisting with program evaluations, ensuring fiscal responsibility, and supporting the mission, vision, and values of University Health while delivering excellent customer service.

####  Position Summary/Responsibilities:

  • Ensure timely monitoring and evaluation of outcome measures for Healthcare Transformation Projects.
  • Identify and track ongoing quality improvement issues and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with various departments and work independently to achieve organizational goals.
  • Develop reports and presentations (oral, visual, and written) with data analysis, utilizing Access Databases and Microsoft Excel.
  • Analyze large healthcare data sets, identifying quality and process improvements.
  • Demonstrate fiscal responsibility with University Health materials and property, supporting the organization's mission and values.

#### Education/Experience:

  • BS/BA degree required.

  • Experience developing comprehensive reports and conducting data analyses preferred.

  • Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required.

Why Join Us? At University Health, you’ll be part of an organization that is dedicated to excellence, innovation, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our employees to succeed and grow—whether that’s advancing your career or enhancing your professional skills. Working at University Health means making a real difference in the lives of our patients and community.

Ready to take the next step in your career? Apply today and become part of the University Health family, where exceptional care and a supportive team environment are at the heart of everything we do!

University Health – Excellence in Patient Care, Excellence in Your Career.

title: IT Business Analyst
job_description:
Job Description and Requirements 

The IT Business Analyst will work closely with business product owners to determine business needs and provide sound recommendations by assessing current business processes and practices. They also collaborate with internal and external technical teams to evaluate feasibility of the recommended solution and document project scope, specifications, and high-level design. In some instances, BA engages with business unit to write and submit a business case. Adheres to established guidelines and documented business best practices, working under the immediate supervision of the IT Application Support Manager to ensure that all solutions align with defined strategic business objectives. 

Essential Functions and Responsibilities: 

  • Lead scope and requirements gathering sessions with business product owners, SME's, end-users, IT colleagues, vendors and management as necessary to analyze process gaps and ensure business requirements and specifications are met and documented. 

  • Serve as a subject matter expert for one or more assigned business units. Provide guidance, analysis and process expertise as necessary. 

  • Participate in design review meetings to ensure design will result in robust, secure and reliable applications in alignment with organizational initiatives. 

  • Research escalated user incidents and provide resolution within the specified Service Level agreement. 

  • Develop project test documentation and execute test cases validating system changes including but not limited to approved product configuration, user permissions, and system processing variables to ensure project delivers the value the business needs and expects. 

  • Actively participate in planning and conducting User Acceptance Testing with the business unit. 

  • Maintain required documentation of project approvals and implementations. 

  • Apply fully tested and approved changes to core production environment. 

  • Independently manage small to medium scale projects, and collaborate with project management by providing time estimates of project tasks assigned, reporting any changes to the manager for large scale and enterprise projects. 

  • Maintain relationships with core processing vendor and support teams, to include monitoring vendor communications for information regarding upcoming system releases, updates, and fixes, and communicate these opportunities to the appropriate business units. 

  • All other duties as assigned (note: essential functions and responsibilities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice) 

Requirements: 

  • High School Diploma or GED with 5 years' relevant experience. Associates Degree in Business or Information Systems preferred. 

  • Minimum of 1 year experience in a Systems Analyst / Business Lead / Application Support role. 

  • Minimum of 2 years experience with Banking / Credit Union Software Applications. 

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in an area of business specialty relevant to Financial Institution operations, such as Lending, Finance, Audit, Member Service, etc. Alternatively, an appropriate combination of education and experience in an IT or Business related field. 

  • Strong analytical & problem solving skills, able to break down complex problems quickly Able to meet and set deadlines with changing priorities 

  • Strong communication & presentation skills, able to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing 

  • Basic understanding of Software Development Life Cycle 

  • Proficient using the Microsoft products such as Word, Paint, Excel, MS Project, Visio, etc. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected status.

title: Internal Only** Business Data Analyst (DCOPS) - Operations Support
job_description:
Grade 20: Salary starts at $70,179.00 annually. Rate of pay depends on qualifications.

## Job Description

JOB SUMMARY

The Business Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining the integrity, validity, and functionality of the respective data for the assigned business group. The Data Analyst will lead and perform complex analysis in an evolving data environment. In addition to having very strong technical skills, this position will have outstanding business process analysis and interpersonal skills. The ability to extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends is needed, with the ability to summarize the data into useable information by leadership. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Maintains integrity of data in system and develops policies and procedures.
  • Oversees the processing of all transactional data entry and the maintenance of all related tables to ensure the accuracy and consistency of all related record changes.
  • Serves as a functional Liaison with Information Services in relation to system implementations, conversions, and upgrades.
  • Assists in the development of business requirements and evaluation of software capabilities as a user in order to ensure the best design of business system solutions.
  • Assists Information Systems as a functional user in the testing of system patches, tables, reports, and software upgrades.
  • Extracts and analyzes data from various systems, such as for the Lawson, or other corporate business systems.
  • Works with the business group to identify and scope new opportunities for data analysis applications to evaluate business performance and to support business decisions.
  • Works internally and with the business group to define, secure and prepare data for modeling.
  • Analyzes, identifies and assesses data attributes using statistical software packages and develops recommendations and processes to improve operational performance ensuring adherence to department policies and procedures.
  • Performs strategic data and trend analysis and research to support business needs, as necessary.
  • Explores data to identify opportunities to improve business results.
  • Develops understanding of business processes, goals and strategies in order to provide analysis and interpretation to management.
  • Develops and provides training to associates and provides technical assistance and support, as needed.
  • Works closely with business stakeholders to identify and answer critical questions.
  • Formulates and prepares ad-hoc and project-related business reports to respond to departmental reporting needs.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

DECISION MAKING

  • The incumbent works under general supervision.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field from an institution accredited by a recognized accrediting agency.
  • Three years' experience developing, analyzing and presenting reports and data.
  • Proficient in the use of computer systems such as Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Visio, and Crystal Reports.

JOB DIMENSIONS

  • Contact with internal and external customers and vendors.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS  
Physical requirements include lifting up to 5 pounds occasionally. Subject to sitting and standing for long periods of time. Requires visual acuity, speech and hearing. Working conditions are primarily in an office environment and performs occasional field visits.  

May be required to work hours other than regular schedule on exception, such as nights, weekends, and holidays.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
job_description:
POSITION SUMMARY/RESPONSIBILITIES   
Responsible for research, data collection, and analysis of health plan data to identify areas for improving cost savings, utilization management, satisfaction, and market share. Serves as a subject-matter expert and coach to other CFHP analysts. It acts as the primary health plan resource to analyze and improve organizational performance. Identifies areas for improvement, documents business processes, researches best practices, and assists process owners to implement change and monitor performance. Interacts extensively with other CFHP departments.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE  
A Bachelor's degree in business, statistics, or a related field is required. Two (2) years of experience conducting data analysis in a managed care environment is preferred. Eight (8) years of experience in a relational database environment (MS SQL Server 2005/2008 or Oracle), including applicable knowledge of Windows and Unix operating systems, may be substituted for the educational requirement. Proficiency in Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Word is required. Experience with SQL or Oracle databases and ESRI Business Analyst is preferred.

title: Senior Data Analyst
job_description:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF WORK:

The Senior Data Analyst will leverage Business Intelligence and Data Analytic best practices to deliver relevant, timely and insightful information to help monitor route performance and to inform service planning and scheduling. This includes gathering, summarizing, and preparing data for geospatial and statistical analysis, data modeling, report creation and automation, end user education and training, understanding and assisting in the development of reporting, analysis and visualization of business data, metrics and measures to allow staff to align and track against overall business strategies, goals and objectives, drive innovation, insight and decision making. Responsible for reports required for the National Transit Database (NTD).  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  
Responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining specific methods and procedures to monitor and evaluate fixed route and other than fixed route service performance.  

Oversees analytical work of Service Analyst and Service Planner/Scheduler/Analyst.  

Responsible for gathering Information/data, compiling statistics, conducting analyses, and preparing management reports related to fixed route and other than fixed route service operational issues.  

Responsible for developing and providing detailed analysis from multiple data sources for functional areas of the business in a way to help facilitate informed decision making. This person must ensure that the department has the necessary data and information for ongoing daily operations and strategic planning.  

Works to understand and lead in the development of reporting, analysis and visualization of business data, metrics, and measures to allow the department to align and track against overall business strategies, goals and objectives, drive innovation, insight and decision making.  

Works with VIA’s Technology & Innovation team to align with VIA’s policy and vision for data organization, structure, and integrity.  

Identifies opportunities to develop forecasts, create financial and statistical models, segmentation schemes and data-driven analyses within relevant technology that can answer questions, uncover trending and bring insight to decision makers.  

Creates mock-ups, dashboards, and scorecards etc., based on the functional area requirements. Develops, refreshes and posts required recurring reports. Develops and produces ad-hoc reports and analysis to assist in decision making.  

Works with department stakeholders to understand the need for reporting tools to drive efficiency and add value.  

Creates descriptive, diagnostic, and reporting solutions. Brings data to life through effective visualizations and storytelling.  

Works with internal and external development teams to acquire and load data from internal  

and external sources, by helping produce data design guidelines, release instructions and other documentation to ensure a manageable data and reporting infrastructure.  

Leads data validation and quality assurance efforts for the data and reporting infrastructure, by validating internal reports against systems of record.  

Develops operational, analytical, and strategic reporting solutions.  

Develops various service data analysis, statistical reporting, and analysis production.  

This job description excludes marginal functions that are incidental to performing the job. Other duties may exist.  

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:  

Must have a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Urban Planning, Data Science, Statistics, or related field with a minimum of 5 years progressively responsible experience in various statistical analysis, or similar role working with business intelligence environments, data analytics or an equivalent combination.  

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:  

Experience conducting sessions with business users to identify data sources, key facts, and dimensions that support the business requirements preferred.  

Must have a customer focused manner, with respect for procedures, policies, and legal requirements.  

Must have relevant knowledge of computer programming, and statistical analysis software such as SPSS, SAS or R.  

Relevant experience with BI data visualization tools.  

Must be able to successfully interact with users at all levels of the organization.  

Must have good verbal and written communication skills.  

Must have ability to read complex materials such as reports, instructions, and support documents.  

Must be able to maintain good work attendance. Safety Accountability Statement:  

  • Employees must consider safety in all tasks performed, as well as demonstrate safe judgment and decisions that not only maintain their own safety; but that of fellow employees and customers.

  • Demonstrate a professional commitment to assure compliance with all organizational policies, practices, and programs; related to safety, health, and system security.

  • Employees have a responsibility to identify and report hazards, as well as potentially unsafe conditions, to your immediate supervisor or Safety Department.

  • Employees are responsible, and required, to stop a job/task to prevent an unsafe incident or act from occurring. This acknowledges the threat of potential injury, property damage and the opportunity for better judgment to be used.

Must comply with and support VIA’s EEO policies and the Diversity Program.  

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:  

Physical ability required to be mobile, bend, stoop, twist, sit, stand, reach, and occasionally lift objects weighing up to 30 pounds.  

WORK ENVIRONMENT:  

Works involves deadlines and multiple priorities. Work within normal office environment. 

VIA is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, providing equal opportunity to all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, or disability.

title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF WORK:

Provides project coordination, functional expertise, and contributes to improvements and enhancements for mission-critical, enterprise-wide information systems. This position is responsible for the smooth operations of all VIA Financial/Maintenance systems and related hardware/software. This includes account administration, maintenance tracking, license tracking and compliance and all technical aspects of maintaining high availability on all VIA financial/maintenance systems. The position is responsible for control for assigned modules or systems, serving as a liaison between functional and technical resources to manage the development of new system functionality, upgrades, system modifications, and day-to-day problem analysis, issue tracking, resolution and change management. Acts as the lead liaison between VIA functional areas and the ERP/EAM systems during implementation and post-implementation. This position is responsible for researching, gathering, and analyzing business, technology, and user requirements for the ERP/EAM system projects.  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  

System Implementation  

Conducts systems analysis and design of business processes involving evaluation of current and proposed information and business process flow, available and emerging technologies and its cost and benefits.  

Leads, develops, and documents user requirements from end user input for new or existing systems, business processes and applications.  

Recommends software and hardware based on systems analysis along with evaluation of products and vendors.  

Creates requests for proposal (RFPs) or requirement specifications and evaluate proposal submissions.  

Leads requirements capturing sessions, drives consensus across departments, and challenges where necessary.  

Shepherds cross-functional teams through all project phases from conception and initiation, planning, execution, performance/monitoring, and project closure.  

Documents systems and business processes according to Technology & Innovation’s standards.  

Serves as an internal consultant to both project teams and to the executive management teams on enterprise analysis and organizational development.  

Resolves or assists in the resolution of conflicts within and between stakeholders, functional areas, and the ERP vendor.  

Develops and maintains a project deliverables plan and a client communication plan. Manages client expectations of deliverables.  

Provides direction and support to project team.  

Provides testing and quality assurance.  

Works with the selected vendor to develop and schedule appropriate training plans.  

Requires general knowledge of policies, procedures, programs, and business goals.  

Supports the organization’s key business processes and applications and recommends business process redesign where applicable.  

Trains personnel in ERP system use to ensure all users know how to leverage system features and assists in implementing and training users on new features and modules.  

Gathers and documents business requirements for large, complex projects.  

Translates requirements into business, functional and use case documents for large, complex projects.  

Provides functional expertise to developers during the design and construction phases of projects.  

Develops and executes comprehensive system test plans, conditions, test scripts, and test cases.  

Maintains business systems standards by applying project management methods, tools and processes as standard practice.  

Responsible for the following items on all financial/maintenance systems: user account creation, system security, hardware maintenance, system tuning, resource monitoring, software installation and configuration.  

Plans, organizes, configures, and documents all financial/maintenance systems and functions.  

System Management  
Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems.  

Researches, plans, gathers, and analyzes business and user requirements for projects.  

Interfaces with projects subject matter experts to analyze and design solutions and to provide recommendations on deliverables.  

Assesses and analyzes processes and procedures to identify improvement opportunities. Creates content that is easy to read, thorough, flows logically, edited, indexed, and formatted.  

Elicits requirements utilizing interview, document analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business, task, and workflow analysis, etc.  

Translates requirements into a document ensuring requirements are clear, concise, and repeatable.  

Analyzes, defines, and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware, and operating system environment, internal and external checks and controls, interfaces with other systems, and outputs.  

Acts as the lead liaison for ERP/EAM communicating user needs to TI and project teams through a variety of project specific documents.  

Identifies and reports on compliance issues that require follow-up or investigation. Track and fully document changes for functional and business specifications.  

Consults with Project Managers, subject matter experts (SME’s), technical staff, and stakeholders to identify, define, interpret, integrate, and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access.  

Acts as a liaison between users and Technology and Innovation in the analysis, design, configuration, testing, and maintenance of case management systems to ensure optimal operational performance.  

Assist vendor with periodic ERP/EAM patch and/or upgrade activities.  

This job description excludes marginal functions that are incidental to performing the job. Other duties may exist.  

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:  

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business or management related discipline with 5 or more years of experience in systems management, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Computer programming experience is desirable.  

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:  

Experience with systems analysis theory, processes and techniques; project spec development; application design; writing and modifying technical and user documentation; prepare flow process diagrams and other design graphics; installation, testing and migration process and techniques; quality and version control processes; use of packaged or off-the-shelf and 3rd party application software including office automation tools would be desirable.  

Considerable working knowledge of methodologies and techniques for systems analysis and design, business process modeling, requirements gathering, quality assurance, and software development.  

Have a customer focused manner, with respect for procedures, policies, and legal requirements.  

Experience in project management and change management.  

Must be able to successfully interact with users at all levels of the organization.  

Must have good verbal and written communication skills.  

Must have the ability to read complex materials such as reports, instructions and manuals.  

Must be able to maintain good work attendance.  

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:  

Physical ability required to be mobile, bend, stoop, twist, sit, stand, reach and occasionally lift objects weighing up to 30 pounds.  

WORK ENVIRONMENT:  

Work involves deadlines and multiple priorities.  

Work within normal office environment.  

May be required to work any time of the day, evening or night during the week or weekend to include being on-call as scheduled.

VIA is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, providing equal opportunity to all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, or disability.

title: Analyst
job_description:
Lone Star Analysis is a growing company offering applied decision intelligence and engineering solutions to enhance innovation, create economic strength, and make the world safer. Since 2004, organizations have trusted Lone Star to deliver actionable answers to complex problems in manufacturing, aerospace, defense, energy, logistics, transportation, and communications.

Position Overview

The Analyst is a mission-critical role within our Operational Optimization Solutions team, tasked with building and maintaining a strategic analytics framework that drives informed leadership decisions and strengthens overall program performance. This key member of the company’s Operational Optimization Solutions team will be reporting to the Programs Manager, Training Solutions position. Operating at the intersection of data and mission execution, this role is responsible for collecting, cleaning, aggregating, and analyzing performance and training data to deliver actionable intelligence. The initial objective is to establish a strong foundation in analytics operations, laying the groundwork for advanced data capabilities that enhance decision-making across all echelons of leadership.

Due to government clearance requirements, this position requires that the applicant be a United States Citizen. Legal residents do not meet this requirement. All work will be performed on-site, in person at a secure facility. This is not a remote work position.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Deliver operational clarity through accurate and timely data analysis
  • Aggregate and clean data from multiple systems and sources related to human performance and development
  • Create dashboards and visualizations to support program management and leadership oversight
  • Contribute to continuous improvement aimed at refining the organization’s analytics infrastructure
  • Develop and refine predictive and prescriptive analytics models and tools
  • Support cross-functional teams with data-driven insights that sharpen execution and boost mission success
  • Assist in the architecture and implementation of scalable data solutions
  • Contribute to the roadmap for mature analytics capabilities
  • Collaborate with performance staff, researchers, and government stakeholders to translate questions into data products
  • Support the development and delivery of recurring reports and strategic updates
  • Serve as a data force multiplier by integrating sources into a cohesive analytics environment
  • Ensure accuracy, clarity, and security of all data outputs

Key Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field
  • Minimum of 2+ years of experience in data mining, and/or 4+ years in a data analyst role, supporting DoD training environments
  • Proficient in tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, or SQL
  • Experience developing analytical dashboards using Power BI
  • Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills
  • Excellent communication skills; verbal and written
  • Must be highly collaborative and capable of working in a team-based environment
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and related software
  • Must be able to obtain a Secret clearance; current clearance preferred

Additional Desirable Qualities

  • Exposure to predictive modeling or machine learning
  • Master’s degree or advanced technical certifications

Expectations do not include

  • All of the desirable attributes within a single candidate

#  Why Lone Star?

Have you ever wanted to…Work on cutting edge issues? Experience what it feels like to have your work truly make a difference? Work in a high trust, high performance environment and feel valued? If the answer is ‘yes’ then Lone Star might be for you. There is one catch however, you can’t hide in our culture. So, if we appeal to you, bring your ‘A’ game.

#  What We Offer

  • A great culture and work environment
  • Heavily subsidized cafeteria style medical, dental & vision
  • Flexible PTO and work hours
  • Some remote work options
  • Company match 401(k)
  • Subsidized HSA (w/ HDHP election)
  • Company paid Life and AD&D
  • Company paid Short- & Long-term Disability
  • Professional Development Reimbursement
  • Variable compensation and equity options
  • Company paid Medical Concierge Service
  • Company paid Identity Theft Protection
  • Lifestyle Spending Account

title: Senior Business Analyst, Information Systems
job_description:
POSITION SUMMARY/RESPONSIBILITIES   
The Senior Information Systems (IS) Business Analyst will have enterprise-level experience supporting IS application development teams and mapping of claims and clinical data. The Senior IS business Analyst will be seen as a change leader across Community First, lead, and provide guidance to Health Care Analysts. This position is expected to be the primary liaison with key Community First business subject-matter experts (SME), collaborating with the business leaders to streamline and re-engineer processes and formulate system requirements, with the goal of delivering automated business solutions.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE  
Bachelor of Science degree in Health Information Management, Information Systems, Data Processing, Mathematical, or Clinical. Eight years' experience in product management or product ownership role(s). MUST have five years’ experience in Health Care, specifically dealing with Managed Care Organization claims and clinical data. Strong technical background and experience with SCRUM, Agile, and other development methodologies. Certifications strongly preferred – SAFe, PMI-ACP, Scrum Alliance. Proficiency with various system development lifecycles such as waterfall, RUP, and Agile methods. Proficiency with MS Office (Including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Project, and Visio). Experience with Jira (Atlassian) Products is a plus. Experience with Cognizant Product suite is a plus – QNXT, Clinical Care Advance, TCS, etc.
